The Terrible Pope (Le Pape Terrible in French) is a French comic by Alejandro Jodorowsky and illustrated by the Italian artist Theo.

The Terrible Pople #1 - Della Rovere (2009)
On August 18, 1503, the victim of a mysterious illness, Pope Alexander VI passes from life to death.  From the first light of dawn, the race for the papal throne begins.  To win the Holy See, nepotism, debauchery, and poison will be more effective than all your prayers.  Among the contenders for the supreme office, none is more formidable than the Cardinal Della Rovere, sworn enemy of the Borgia clan.  To reach the highest office, this holy man would not hesitate to even sell his soul to the devil...

The Terrible Pope #2 - Jules II (2011)
Vatican, 1504.  The coffers are empty, the heart of the Holy Father is as well.  Betrayed by his family, Julius becomes ever more cruel.  His meetings with the volatile Michelangelo seem for a time to appease his sufferings, but on the way to power and glory, nothing can alter the determination of the most militaristic Pope in history...

This contains the corrected version of The Terrible Pope #2 (English translation of pages 26 and 49).

Thanks goes to Team Dragonz - Tanim (translation), Choky27 (lettering), and Onairam (proofreading) for this release.
